PT J
AN ZOOR15312085188
DT Article
TI Taxonomic and faunistic notes on some West Palaearctic and Middle Asian
   Xantholinini, with a revalidation and new synonymies (Coleoptera:
   Staphylinidae: Staphylininae).
AU Assing, Volker (vassing.hann@t-online.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 235-252
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 3
AB Xantholinus motschulskyi BORDONI, 1999, previously a synonym of X
   reitteri COIFFAIT, 1966, is revalidated. The internal structures of the
   aedeagus of X motschulskyi, X reitteri, and X corallinus REITTER, 1901
   are illustrated. A lectotype is designated for X. corallinus. Seven
   synonymies are proposed: Gyrohypnus punctulatus (PAYKULL, 1789) =
   Gyroyhypnus quadratus STEPHENS, 1833, nov.syn.; Stenistoderus cephalotes
   cephalotes (KRAATZ, 1858) = S. cephalotes armeniacus (COIFFAIT, 1966),
   nov.syn.; Xantholinus linearis (OLIVIER, 1795) = X styriacus GRIMMER,
   1841, nov.syn.; X gridellii COIFFAIT, 1956 = X tronqueti BORDONI, 2016,
   nov.syn.; X khnzoriani COIFFAIT, 1966 = X caucasicus BORDONI, 1975,
   nov.syn., = X iablokoffi COIFFAIT, 1975, nov.syn.; X motschulskyi
   BORDONI, 1999 = X chalusianus BORDONI, 2017, nov.syn. A neotype is
   designated for Gyroyhypnus quadratus STEPHENS, 1833. New records of 37
   species of Xantholinini are reported. The revised distributions of X
   reitteri and X motschulskyi are mapped.
C1 Assing, Volker; Gabelsbergerstr 2, Hannover, D-30163, Germany, Germany.
EM vassing.hann@t-online.de
SC Zoology
SN 0253-116X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; Type material; Synonymy; Land zones;
   Palaearctic region; Eurasia
DE Xantholinini [Palaearctic region / West / Distribution; new record;
   systematics] [Asia / Middle / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Staphylinoidea,
   Staphylinidae
OR Gyrohypnus punctulatus - (Paykull 1789) (Staphylinidae): [Neotype
   designated, P. 238; Syn nov, Gyrohypnus quadratus Stephens 1833, p.
   238]. 
   Stenistoderus cephalotes cephalotes - (Kraatz 1858) (Staphylinidae):
   [Syn nov, Leptolinus cephalotes armeniacus Coiffait 1966, p. 240]. 
   Xantholinini - Erichson 1839 (Staphylinidae): [New record]. 
   Xantholinus (Heterolius) khnzoriani - Coiffait 1966 (Staphylinidae):
   [Syn nov, Xantholinus (Heterolinus) caucasicus Bordoni 1975, p. 241; Syn
   nov, Xantholinus (Heterolinus) iablokoffi Coiffait 1975, p. 241]. 
   Xantholinus (Typhlolinus) gridellii - Coiffait 1956 (Staphylinidae):
   [Syn nov, Xantholinus tronqueti Bordoni 2016, p. 245]. 
   Xantholinus (Typhlolinus) motschulskyi - Bordoni 1999 (Staphylinidae):
   [Syn nov, Xantholinus chalusianus Bordoni 2017, p. 245; Removal from
   synonymy, With Xantholinus (Typhlolinus) reitteri Coiffait 1966, p.
   245]. 
   Xantholinus (Typhlolinus) reitteri - Coiffait 1966 (Staphylinidae):
   [Removal from synonymy, Xantholinus (Typhlolinus) motschulskyi Bordoni
   1999, p. 245]. 
   Xantholinus (Xantholinus) linearis - (Olivier 1795) (Staphylinidae):
   [Syn nov, Xantholinus styriacus Grimmer 1841, p. 246].

TI Two new species and additional records of micropterous Paederus from
   China and Taiwan (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Paederinae).
AU Assing, Volker (vassing.hann@t-online.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 253-263
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Two species of Paederus FABRICIUS, 1775 from China and Taiwan are
   described and illustrated: Paederus (Gnathopaederus) furcillatus nov.sp.
   (China: Guizhou) and P. (Megalopaederus) nigricrus nov.sp. (Taiwan:
   Taitung Hsien). Additional records of eight species of Harpopaederus
   SCHEERPELTZ, 1957 (two species), Gnathopaederus CHAPIN, 1927 (one
   species), Megalopaederus SCHEERPELTZ, 1957 (three species), and of the
   P. biacutus group (two species) are reported. The genus is currently
   represented in China and Taiwan by 51 and 25 species respectively.

DT Article
TI Four new species and additional records of Lathrobium from Nepal and
   China (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Paederinae).
AU Assing, Volker (vassing.hann@t-online.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 285-297
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Four species of Lathrobium GRAVENHORST, 1802 are described and
   illustrated: Lathrobium kongmaicum nov.sp. (East Nepal: Kongma Danda),
   L. latilobatum nov.sp. (East Nepal: Kongma Danda), and L. paulitortum
   nov.sp. (East Nepal: Solu Khumbu) of the L. nepalense group, and L.
   piraticum nov.sp. (China: Sichuan: Wolong) of the L. fissispinosum
   group. Additional records of three species from China and three species
   from Nepal are reported, among them the first recent records of L.
   nepalorientis COIFFAIT, 1984 and L. khumbuense COIFFAIT, 1982. The genus
   is now represented in the Palaearctic region by 595 species and nine
   subspecies. The Himalayan fauna currently includes 76 described species,
   all of them micropterous and locally endemic. As many as 220 named
   species have been recorded from China.
C1 Assing, Volker; Gabelsbergerstr 2, Hannover, D-30163, Germany, Germany.
EM vassing.hann@t-online.de

TI A revision of Nazeris IX. Three new species from Nepal and additional
   records (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Paederinae).
AU Assing, Volker (vassinghann@t-online.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 307-315
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Three species of Nazeris FAUVEL, 1875 of the N. flavocaudatus group from
   East Nepal are described and illustrated: Nazeris biapicalis nov.sp., N.
   hebes nov.sp., and N. trapezilobus nov.sp. Additional records of three
   previously described species are reported from East Nepal and Lebanon.
   The pronounced intraspecific variation of external and sexual characters
   of N. ammonita (SAULCY, 1865) is discussed and illustrated. The genus
   now includes a total of 250 described species and seven subspecies. It
   is represented in the Himalaya (exclusive of China) by 52 described
   species.

TI A revision of Neosclerus CAMERON VI. Three new species from India,
   Thailand, and Vietnam (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Paederinae).
AU Assing, Volker (vassing.hann@t-online.de)

PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0

AB Three species of Neosclerus CAMERON, 1924 are described and illustrated:
   N. anguliceps nov.sp. (South India), a species of uncertain
   affiliations, N. concavus nov.sp. (Thailand) of the N brevispinosus
   group, and N. vietnamensis nov.sp. (Vietnam) of the N. brevispinosus
   group. The latter species represents the second record of the genus from
   Vietnam. Including the new species, the genus now includes 47 species
   distributed in the southern East Palaearctic and Oriental regions.

   representative of the genus to be recorded from outside Yunnan, is

AB Types and additional material from the Iablokoff-Khnzorian collection
   are revised. The following synonymies are proposed: Olophrum puncticolle
   EPPELSHEIM, 1880 = O. erevanicum IABLOKOFF-KHNZORIAN, 1964, nov.syn.;
   Astenus procerus (GRAVENHORST, 1806) = Astenus silvicola
   IABLOKOFF-KHNZORIAN, 1961, nov.syn.; Myrmoecia reitteri (EPPELSHEIM,
   1881) = Zyras argus IABLOKOFF-KHNZORIAN, 1960, nov.syn.; Aleochara
   (Xenochara) rambouseki LIKOVSKY, 1964 = A. addenda LIKOVSKY, 1981,
   nov.syn., = A. hamulata ASSING, 2009, nov.syn. The holotypes of Rugilus
   armeniacus (COIFFAIT, 1970), Aleochara polychroma IABLOKOFF-KHNZORIAN,
   1966, and A. nobilis LIKOVSKY, 1965 are illustrated. The latter is moved
   to the subgenus Xenochara MULSANT & REY, 1874 (ex Heterochara MULSANT &
   REY, 1874). Seven species of Staphylinidae are reported from Armenia and
   one from Slovenia for the first time. The record of one species from
   Armenia is based on a misentification.
C1 Assing, Volker; Gabelsbergerstr 2, Hannover, D-30163, Germany, Germany.
EM vassing.hann@t-online.de

DT Article
TI On some Athetini from Armenia and adjacent regions (Coleoptera:
   Staphylinidae: Aleocharinae).
AU Assing, Volker (vassing.hann@t-online.de) 
   Vogel, Jurgen
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 341-368
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Nine species of Athetini from Armenia are described and illustrated,
   eight of them for the first time: Atheta (Atheta) brevapicalis nov.sp.
   (South Armenia); A. (A.) hamulata nov.sp. (South Armenia); A.
   (Dimetrota) bispinosa nov.sp. (Armenia, Georgia); A. (D.) senticollis
   nov.sp. (North Armenia); A. (Oreostiba) altiviva BENICK, 1974
   (widespread in Armenia); A. (O.) semialba nov.sp. (widespread in
   Armenia); A. (O.) abscisa nov.sp. (widespread in Armenia); A. (O.)
   brevitheca nov.sp. (widespread in Armenia); Liogluta armeniaca nov.sp.
   (Central and South Armenia). Three synonymies are proposed: Atheta
   hansseni STRAND, 1943 = A. brachati ASSING, 2013, nov.syn.; Liogluta
   granigera (KIESENWETTER, 1850) = L. trigemina (EPPELSHEIM, 1880),
   nov.syn.; L. funesta EPPELSHEIM, 1890 = L. nigrobusta ASSING, 2016,
   nov.syn. A lectotype is designated for Homalota trigemina EPPELSHEIM,
   1880.

TI On Stilicoderus VI. Two new species from South Vietnam and additional
   records (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Paederinae).
AU Assing, Volker (vassing.hann@t-online.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 369-376
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Two species of Stilicoderus SHARP, 1889 from South Vietnam are described
   and illustrated: Stilicoderus bisinuatus nov.sp. of the S. granulifrons
   group and S. harpago nov.sp. of the S. discalis group. Additional
   records of five species are reported, among them a new record from
   Bhutan. The genus now includes a total of 113 species.

TI On Micrambe THOMSON, 1863 of China (Coleoptera: Cryptophagidae).
AU Esser, Jens (ens_esser@yahoo.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 387-394
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB One species of Micrambe THOMSON, 1863, M sinensis GROUVELLE, 1910, is
   revalidated, three species (M schuelkei nov.sp., M yunnanensis nov.sp.
   and M zhejiangensis nov.sp.) are described and illustrated. A key and a
   provisional catalogue for Micrambe of China are given. The distribution
   of M bimaculata (PANZER, 1798) is discussed.

PT J
AN ZOOR15312085202
DT Article
TI Scarodytes costatus nov. sp from the Bingol Province in Turkey, the
   first species of the genus with costate elytra (Insecta: Coleoptera:
   Dytiscidae: Deronectina).
AU Aykut, Medeni (medeniaykut@hotmail.com) 
   Fery, Hans
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 395-414
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Scarodytes costatus nov.sp. is described from the Bingol Province in
   eastern Turkey. At first glance the new species is externally similar to
   species of the Nebrioporus carinatus-complex which are endemic to the
   Iberian Peninsula and the French Pyrenees. A thorough study of the
   extern morphology and of the male genitalia shows, however, that the new
   species must be placed in the genus Scarodytes Gozis, 1914. This is the
   first species of the genus with distinct costae on the elytra. So far
   the species has been found only in the type locality. The new species is
   described in detail, its habitus, male genitalia and other features are
   illustrated and its systematic position is thoroughly discussed. Notes
   on the "mesoventral column" are added as well as a discussion about the
   potential function of elytral costae as defence against loss of
   manoeuvrability by the "Bernoulli principle".
C1 Aykut, Medeni; Dicle Univ, Sci & Technol, Diyarbakir, TR-21280, Turkey,
   Turkey.
EM medeniaykut@hotmail.com
SC Anatomy &Morphology; Zoology; Biophysics
SN 0253-116X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; General morphology; Appendages;
   Biophysics; Locomotion; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia
DE Scarodytes [General morphology / Mesoventral column / defensive
   functions; systematics] [Wings / Elytral costae / ] [Biomechanics /
   Manoeuvrability loss / ] [Flight /  / ]. 
   Scarodytes costatus [Turkey /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Adephaga, Caraboidea,
   Dytiscidae
OR Scarodytes - Gozis 1914 (Dytiscidae). 
   Scarodytes costatus (Dytiscidae): [Sp nov, Turkey, P. 397]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15312085202
DA 2020-09-17
ER

DT Article
TI Five new species of the Anthracus annamensis group from the Philippines
   and India (Coleoptera, Carabidae, Harpalini, Stenolophina).
AU Jaeger, Bernd (acupalpus.bj@gmx.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 585-608
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Five new species of the Anthracus annamensis group are described from
   the Philippines and India: Anthracus darlingtoni nov.sp. (type locality:
   Philippines: Leyte: Plains of NE Leyte), A. mindanaoensis nov.sp. (type
   locality: Philippines: Mindanao: Davao del Norte: Madaum R. Tagum), A.
   brevipennis nov.sp. (type locality: Philippines: Leyte: Plains of NE
   Leyte), A. nathani nov.sp. (type locality: India: Tamil Nadu: Karikal
   territory, Kurumbagaram), and A. leyteensis nov.sp. (type locality:
   Philippines: Leyte: Plains of NE Leyte). New distribution data are
   presented for: Anthracus philippinensis JAEGER, 2015 (additional records
   for Luzon and first record for Leyte) and A. anichtchenkoi JAEGER, 2015
   (first and southernmost record from the Indian state of Tamil Nadu).

DT Article
TI The Digger Wasps of the Peloponnese (Hymenoptera: Apoidea) Part 1:
   Ampulicidae, Sphecidae, Crabronidae: Entomosericinae and Philanthinae;
   with Description of a new Palmodes type.
FT Die Grabwespen der Peloponnes (Hymenoptera: Apoidea) 1. Teil:
   Ampulicidae, Sphecidae, Crabronidae: Entomosericinae und Philanthinae;
   mit Beschreibung einer neuen Palmodes-Art.
AU Arens, Werner (bw.arens@gmx.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 619-655
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA German
U1 0
U2 0
AB In 1995 a project for recording the Aculeata living on the Peloponnes
   (Southern Greece) has been started, in the course of which over 50
   localities from the coastal dunes and the Arcadian basin landscapes up
   to the tops of the high mountains have been visited several times in
   spring and summer. The results on the Vespidae and a part of the
   Chrysididae have already been published. Now a first report on the
   digger wasps is given that deals with the 68 species of the Ampulicidae,
   Sphecidae, Entomosericinae and Philanthinae. A new species (Palmodes
   intermedius nov.sp.) is described. Dolichurus bicolor LEPELETIER, 1845,
   Isodontia mexicana (SAUSSURE, 1867), and Prionyx crudelis (F. SMITH,
   1856) have been recorded for the first time in Greece; some other
   species are new for the Peloponnese. The hitherto unknown prey of
   Entomosericus concinnus DAHLBOM, 1845 are larvae of the leafhopper
   family Issidae.
C1 Arens, Werner; Mersseberg 38, Bad Hersfeld, D-36251, Germany, Germany.
EM bw.arens@gmx.de
SC Zoology
SN 0253-116X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Taxonomy; Key; Land zones;
   Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe
DE Cerceris interrupta; Cerceris media; Cerceris quadrifasciata; Cerceris
   quinquefasciata [Greece / Peloponnese / New record]. 
   Dolichurus bicolor; Isodontia mexicana; Prionyx crudelis [Greece /  /
   New record]. 
   Palmodes interinedius [Greece /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Hymenopterans; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Hymenoptera, Apocrita, Aculeata,
   Sphecoidea, Sphecidae
OR Cerceris - Latreille 1803 (Sphecidae): [Key to species, Based on
   irregular abdomen drawing and basal plate on the 2nd sternite, p. 648]. 
   Cerceris interrupta (Sphecidae): [New record]. 
   Cerceris media (Sphecidae): [New record]. 
   Cerceris quadrifasciata (Sphecidae): [New record]. 
   Cerceris quinquefasciata (Sphecidae): [New record]. 
   Dolichurus bicolor (Sphecidae): [New record]. 
   Isodontia mexicana (Sphecidae): [New record]. 
   Palmodes interinedius (Sphecidae): [Sp nov, Greece, P. 628]. 
   Prionyx crudelis (Sphecidae): [New record].

DT Article
TI Hardya helgae nov. sp., a new leafhopper species from Central Europe
   (Hemiptera: Auchenorrhyncha: Cicadellidae).
AU Nickel, Herbert (herbertnickel@gmx.de) 
   Holzinger, Werner E.
   Remane, Reinhard
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 707-719
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB act: A new species of the leafhopper genus Hardya EDWARDS, 1922 from the
   southwestern parts of Germany, Luxembourg and Eastern France is
   described. It is similar to the widespread species Hardya tenuis
   (GERMAR, 1821), but differs significantly in the shape of the genital
   plates, body size and wing length of females. There are also differences
   in habitat preferences: Hardya helgae nov.sp. is confined to more or
   less dry calcareous grassland and feeds on Bromus erectus, whereas H.
   tenuis feeds on Festuca ovina and occurs also in acidic grasslands.
   There is strong evidence that the new species has, together with its
   host plant and correlated with changing land use, immigrated into
   central Europe rapidly only within the last decades.
C1 Nickel, Herbert; Zikaden Biodiversitat Graslandmanagement, Ehrengard
   Schramm Weg 2, Gottingen, D-37085, Germany, Germany.
EM herbertnickel@gmx.de
SC Zoology
SN 0253-116X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Diagnosis; Available name;
   Taxonomy; Key; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe
DE Hardya [Europe / central / Key to species]. 
   Hardya helgae [France /  / New species] [Germany /  / ] [Luxembourg /  /
   ]. 
TN Arthropods; Insects; Invertebrates; True Bugs
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Hemiptera, Homoptera, Auchenorrhyncha,
   Cicadelloidea, Cicadellidae
OR Hardya - Edwards 1922 (Cicadellidae): [Diagnostic characters of
   subordinate taxa, European species, p. 712; Key to species, Europe,
   central, P. 711]. 
   Hardya helgae (Cicadellidae): [Sp nov, Germany, P. 708]. 
   Thamnotettix aphrodoides - Haupt 1935 (Cicadellidae): [Status, P. 714]. 
   Thamnotettix tenuis confusa - Rrey 1894 (Cicadellidae): [Nomen dubium,
   P. 712].

DT Article
TI Schilskyana nom.n.: a replacement name for Haplothrix SCHILSKY, 1896 nec
   GAHAN, 1888 (Coleoptera, Dasytidae).
AU Plonski, Isidor S. (isidor.plonski@gmx.at) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 745-748
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The genus name Haplothrix SCHILSKY, 1896 (Coleoptera: Dasytidae:
   Chaetomalachiinae) is a junior homonym of Haplothrix GAHAN, 1888
   (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae: Monochamini). Thus, a replacement
   name, Schilskyana nom.n., is proposed for Haplothrix SCHILSKY, 1896 nec
   GAHAN, 1888. All 15 species of Haplothrix SCHILSKY, 1896 are
   transferred, resulting in the following new combinations: Schilskyana
   aequalis (REITTER, 1885) comb.n., S. armeniaca (KIESENWETTER, 1878)
   comb.n., S. captiosa (MATER, 1989) comb.n., S. chalif (MATER, 1989)
   comb.n., S. effusa (MATER, 1989) comb.n., S. leucosa (MATER, 1989)
   comb.n., S. mera (MATER, 1989) comb.n., S. pospisili (MATER, 1989)
   comb.n., S. prudeki (MATER, 1996) comb.n., S. pusilla (SCHTLSKY, 1896)
   comb.n., S. ruficollis (REITTER, 1889) comb.n., S. sanguinicollis
   (MATER, 1989) comb.n., S. soluta (MATER, 1989) comb.n., S. subtilis
   (REITTER, 1885) comb.n., and S. vana (MATER, 1989) comb.n.
C1 Plonski, Isidor S.; Rembrandtstr 1-4, Vienna, A-1020, Austria, Austria.
EM isidor.plonski@gmx.at
SC Zoology
SN 0253-116X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; Combination; Available name; Taxonomy;
   Taxonomic position
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Cleroidea,
   Melyridae

DT Article
TI Synopsis of the species of the genus Stenus LATREILLE with unmargined
   abdomen and bilobed tarsi (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae).
FT Stenus LATREILLE mit seitlich ungerandetem Abdomen und gelappten Tarsen
   (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae) 351. Beitrag zur Kenntnis der Steninen.
AU Puthz, Volker (Stenus.Puthz@t-online.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 749-883
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA German
U1 0
U2 2
AB The neotropic Stenus species with unmargined abdomen and bilobed tarsi
   are reviewed, nearctic species of groups occurring in the Neotropics are
   included; 3 further species from other groups are added. 31 new species
   are described: Stenus absconditus nov.sp. (Costa Rica), S. acupictus
   nov.sp. (Bolivia), S. anatipenis nov.sp. (Suriname), S. balzani nov.sp.
   (Bolivia), S. brevivestis nov.sp. (Colombia), S. fulgurans nov.sp.
   (Colombia), S. guagua nov.sp. (Peru), S. graciliformis nov.sp.
   (Ecuador), S. igarapecola nov.sp. (Brazil), S. incisiventris nov.sp.
   (Venezuela), S. inexoptatus nov.sp. (Mexico), S. interpolator nov.sp.
   (Ecuador), S. inutilis nov.sp. (Brazil), S. laboriosus nov.sp. (Brazil),
   S. lapsus nov.sp. (Brazil), S. lavinia nov.sp. (Ecuador), S. lindemanni
   nov.sp. (Brazil), S. nigratus nov.sp. (Nicaragua), S. ocrearius nov.sp.
   (Costa Rica), S. pilosivestis nov.sp. (Panama), S. quipu nov.sp. (Peru),
   S. rectipunctus nov.sp. (Ecuador), S. repentinus nov.sp. (Brazil), S.
   sharkeyi nov.sp. (Ecuador), S. shepardi nov.sp. (French Guiana), S.
   similigenus nov.sp. (Colombia), S. struyvei nov.sp. (Panama), S.
   surinamus nov.sp. (Suriname), S. tim nov.sp. (Panama), S. vexabilis
   nov.sp. (Brazil), S. vexator nov.sp. (Colombia). Five new synonymies are
   presented: S. asperatus SHARP, 1886 nov.syn. = S. laetipes SHARP, 1886;
   S. denieri BERNHAUER, 1939 nov.syn. = S. chiriquensis SHARP, 1886, S.
   peregrinus SHARP, 1886 nov.syn. = S. capucinus BOHEMAN, 1858; S.
   pertinax CASEY, 1884 nov.syn. = S. dissentiens CASEY, 1884; S. spicatus
   PUTHZ, 1974 nov.syn. = S. paraguyanus BERNHAUER, 1923. Many first
   records are listed and descriptions of characters, hitherto unknown, are
   given, the aedeagus of all species, of which males are known, is
   figured. A key to species groups, a checklist of the distribution
   according to states and a map of the distribution of Stenus-species in
   the world are added.
C1 Puthz, Volker; Burgmuseum Schlitz, Nat Wissensch Abt, Vorderburg 1,
   Schlitz, D-36110, Germany, Germany.
EM Stenus.Puthz@t-online.de
SC Zoology
SN 0253-116X

   Key; Documentation; Publications; Land zones; Nearctic region;
   Neotropical region; North America; Central America; South America

DT Article
TI Contribution to the Ichneumoninae (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae) of
   Southeastern Asia: 3. Heresiarchini.
AU Riedel, Matthias (mamaflo.riedel@t-online.de) 
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 895-917
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB In this publication, distributional records are given for 61 species of
   Oriental Heresiarchini (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae, Ichneumoninae),
   mainly from Laos. Six taxa are described as new: Aglaojoppa parafemorata
   nov.sp., Coelichneumon fulvipennoides nov.sp., Coelichneumon scopator
   nov.sp., Coelichneumon superomediae nov.sp., Ileanta laotica nov.sp.,
   and Pseudocillimops mesonotator nov.sp. The unknown [female] of
   Aglaojoppa violaceipennis CAMERON, 1903, Coelichneumon fulvipes CAMERON,
   1903, and Naenarides malaisei HEINRICH, 1969 are described for the first
   time as well as the unknown [male] of Coelichneumon laoticus RIEDEL,
   2013, Coelichneumon parachinicus RIEDEL, 2013, and Euheresiarches
   amoenus HEINRICH, 1970. Neofacydes nigroguttatus (UCHIDA, 1935) was
   re-placed in the genus Neofacydes HEINRICH.
C1 Riedel, Matthias; Barenbadstr 11, Oberammergau, D-82487, Germany,
   Germany.
EM mamaflo.riedel@t-online.de

DT Article
TI Description of Acupalpus orszuliki nov. sp (Coleoptera, Carabidae,
   Harpalini, Stenolophina) and faunistic notes on some species previously
   described.
AU Wrase, David W. (carterus@gmx.de) 
   Jaeger, Bernd
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 919-926
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Description of Acupalpus orszuliki nov.sp. (type locality: Hop Gecidi,
   Mardin env., Mardin prov., Turkey). Illustrations of the habitus, head,
   pronotum, and the median lobe of the male genitalia including its
   internal sac are presented, and comparisons are made with related
   species. Three species are mentioned with first records: Stenolophus
   (Egadroma) pseudoobockianus FELIX & MUILWIJK, 2009 for Iran, Stenolophus
   (s.str.) steveni KRYNICKY, 1832 for Greece, and Anthracus quarnerensis
   (REILLER, 1884) for Lebanon. Additional location data are given for
   Acupalpus (Ancylostria) morulus REITTER, 1884 (Lebanon, Turkey).
C1 Wrase, David W.; Dunckerstr 78, Berlin, D-10437, Germany, Germany.
EM carterus@gmx.de
SC Zoology
SN 0253-116X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Palaearctic region;
   Eurasia; Asia; Europe
DE Acupalpus (Acupalpus) orszuliki [Turkey /  / New species] [Syria /  / ].
   
   Acupalpus (Ancylostria) morulus [Lebanon /  / Systematics; occurrence
   records]. 
   Anthracus quarnerensis [Lebanon /  / New record; systematics]. 
   Stenolophus (Egadroma) pseudoobockianus [Iran /  / New record;
   systematics]. 
   Stenolophus (Stenolophus) steveni [Greece /  / New record; systematics].
   
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Adephaga, Caraboidea,
   Carabidae
OR Acupalpus (Acupalpus) orszuliki (Carabidae): [Sp nov, Turkey, P. 920]. 
   Acupalpus (Ancylostria) morulus - Reitter 1884 (Carabidae). 
   Anthracus quarnerensis - (Reitter 1884) (Carabidae): [New record]. 
   Stenolophus (Egadroma) pseudoobockianus - Felix & Muilwijk 2009
   (Carabidae): [New record]. 
   Stenolophus (Stenolophus) steveni - Krynicky 1832 (Carabidae): [New
   record].

DT Article
TI Description of a new Nebria (Eunebria) species from Iran (Coleoptera,
   Carabidae: Nebriini) and faunistic data for Nebria (Eunebria) xanthacra
   xanthacra CHAUDOIR, 1850.
AU Wrase, David W. (carterus@gmx.de) 
   Schnitter, Peer H.
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 927-935
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new species of Nebria LATREILLE, 1802, subgenus Eunebria JEANNEL,
   1937, is described from Iran, Kerman Province: N. kazemii nov.sp. (Type
   locality: waterfall at Darb-e Asiab vill. nr. Kuhpayeh vill., N Kerman,
   2600 m, N30[degree]31'18.4''/E 57[degree]09'44.6'', Iran). Illustrations
   of the habitus of the new species and of N. boiteli ALLUAUD, 1932, the
   median lobe of the male genitalia of the new species and the spermatheca
   of the new species and of N. xanthacra CHAUDOIR, 1850 are presented, and
   comparisons with related species are made, completed with information
   about biotope and distribution, additionally faunistic data for N.
   (Eunebria) xanthacra xanthacra CHAUDOIR, 1850 are given.
C1 Wrase, David W.; Dunckerstr 78, Berlin, D-10437, Germany, Germany.
EM carterus@gmx.de

   Systematics; occurrence record]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates

DT Article
TI A new species of Solierella SPINOLA, 1851 from Greece (Hymenoptera,
   Crabronidae).
AU Schmid-Egger, Christian (christian@bembix.de) 
   Arens, Werner
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 937-940
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Solierella graeca SCHMID-EGGER & ARENS nov.sp. is described from the
   Peloponnese in Greece. Holotype is a male, the female is unknown. The
   species is characterized by 12 antennal segments in combination with a
   black pronotum and a black forefemur.

DT Article
TI The genus Nomada (Hymenoptera: Apidae) in Siberia.
AU Proshchalykin, Maxim Yu. (proshchalikin@biosoil.ru) 
   Schwarz, Maximilian
SO Linzer Biologische Beitraege
VL 49
IS 1
PS 985-1006
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Forty-seven species and three subspecies of the bee genus Nomada Scopoli
   are recorded from Siberia. Nomada irkutskiensis PROSHCHALYKIN & SCHWARZ,
   nov.sp. is described from Buryatia Republic and Irkutsk Province,
   Russia. Eight species: Nomada alboguttata HERRICH-SCHAFFER, 1839, N.
   basalis HERRICH SCHAFFER, 1839, N. fuscicornis NYLANDER, 1848, N.
   guttulata SCHENCK, 1861, N. italica DALLA TORRE & FRIESE, 1894, N.
   integra BRULLE, 1832, N. setteri PROSHCHALYKIN, 2010, and N.
   radoszkowskii LOZINSKI, 1922 and two subspecies: N. mauritanica
   cluysopyga MORAWITZ, 1872, and N. panzeri glabella THOMSON, 1870 are
   newly recorded from Siberia. The distribution data of other species is
   enlarged. The male of N. setteri PROSHCHALYKIN, 2010 is here described
   for the first time.
C1 Proshchalykin, Maxim Yu.; Russian Acad Sci, Fed Sci Ctr East Asia Terr
   Biodivers, 100 Let Vladivostoku Ave 159, Vladivostok, 690022, Russia,
   Russia.
EM proshchalikin@biosoil.ru
SC Zoology
SN 0253-116X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Description; Documentation;
   Publications; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia
DE Nomada [Checklists /  / Taxonomic review] [Russia / Siberia / ]. 
   Nomada alboguttata; Nomada basalis; Nomada fuscicornis; Nomada
   guttulata; Nomada integra; Nomada italica; Nomada mauritanica
   cluysopyga; Nomada panzeri glabella; Nomada radoszkowskii; Nomada
   setteri [Russia / Siberia / New record]. 
   Nomada irkutskiensis [Russia /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Hymenopterans; Insects; Invertebrates

   Apidae

   Nomada alboguttata (Apidae): [New record]. 
   Nomada basalis (Apidae): [New record]. 
   Nomada fuscicornis (Apidae): [New record]. 
   Nomada guttulata (Apidae): [New record]. 
   Nomada integra (Apidae): [New record]. 
   Nomada irkutskiensis (Apidae): [Sp nov, Russia, P. 992].

PT J
AN ZOOR15311071976
DT Article
TI Faunistic survey of pseudoscorpions (Arachnida: Pseudoscorpiones)
   collected from compost heaps in Slovakia.
AU Christophoryova, Jana (christophoryova@gmail.com) 
   Kanuchova, Andrea
   Krajcovicova, Katarina
SO Klapalekiana
VL 53
IS 1-2
PS 11-19
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The present paper gives new records of pseudoscorpions collected from
   compost heaps. Material from 31 localities in Slovakia was investigated
   during four years of research. A total of 1799 pseudoscorpions of 14
   taxa from four families were examined. The most abundant were the
   families Chthoniidae and Chernetidae; only one cheliferid specimen was
   recorded during the study. The most abundant taxa were typical
   inhabitants of compost heaps, chernetid pseudoscorpions of the genus
   Lamprochernes Tomosvary, 1882 and the species Pselaphochernes
   scorpioides (Hermann, 1804). The taxa Chthonius carinthiacus Beier,
   1951, Chthonius boldorii Beier, 1934, Mun-dochthonius carpaticus
   Rafalski, 1948, Neobisiwn fuscimanum (C. L. Koch, 1843), Neobisium
   sylvaticum (C. L. Koch, 1835) and Roncus sp. were recorded in
   decomposing material for the first time in Slovakia.
C1 Christophoryova, Jana; Comenius Univ, Fac Nat Sci, Ilkovicova 6,
   Bratislava, SK-84215, Slovakia, Slovakia.
EM christophoryova@gmail.com
SC Zoology; Environmental Sciences &Ecology
SN 1210-6100
BD Habitat; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe
DE Chthonius (Chthonius) carinthiacus; Chthonius (Ephippiochthonius)
   boldorii; Mundochthonius carpaticus; Neobisium (Neobisium) fuscimanum;
   Neobisium (Neobisium) sylvaticum; Roncus [Man made habitat / Compost
   heaps / New record] [Slovakia /  / ]. 
   Pseudoscorpiones [Man made habitat / Compost heaps / Faunal list;
   faunistic survey] [Slovakia /  / ]. 
TN Arachnids; Arthropods; Chelicerates; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Arachnida, Pseudoscorpionida
OR Chthonius (Chthonius) carinthiacus (Pseudoscorpionida): [New record]. 
   Chthonius (Ephippiochthonius) boldorii (Pseudoscorpionida): [New
   record]. 
   Mundochthonius carpaticus (Pseudoscorpionida): [New record]. 
   Neobisium (Neobisium) fuscimanum (Pseudoscorpionida): [New record]. 
   Neobisium (Neobisium) sylvaticum (Pseudoscorpionida): [New record]. 
   Pseudoscorpiones (Pseudoscorpionida). 
   Roncus (Pseudoscorpionida): [New record]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15311071976
DA 2020-09-17

AB Notoxus monpa sp. nov. is described from single male specimen collected
   in northeastern India (Arunachal Pradesh). The first record of N.
   hilaris Kejval, 2011 from India (Assam) is presented.

PT J
AN ZOOR15311071982
DT Article
TI The Palaearctic species of Aulacoderus LaFerte-Senectere (Coleoptera:
   Anthicidae).
AU Kejval, Zbynek (anthicid@seznam.cz) 
SO Klapalekiana
VL 53
IS 1-2
PS 55-133
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The genus Aulacoderus LaFerte-Senectere, 1849 is redescribed and its
   Palaearctic species are revised. Aulacoderus postnotatus (Pic, 1910),
   stat. restit., is removed from synonymy with Aulacoderus sefrensis (Pic,
   1894). Aulacoderus canariensis bucheti (Pic, 1903) is elevated to
   species level. Eleven species are newly described: Aulacoderus adensis
   sp. nov. (Yemen), A. crenulifer sp. nov. (Spain: Canary Islands), A.
   inspinosus sp. nov. (Oman, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), A. kamil sp.
   nov. (Iran), A. klapperichi sp. nov. (Israel, Jordan), A. kormosi sp.
   nov. (Spain: Canary Islands), A. mithra sp. nov. (Iran, Turkey), A.
   polygoni sp. nov. (Spain: Canary Islands), A. sibilans sp. nov. (Spain:
   Canary Islands), A. setifer sp. nov. (Spain: Canary Islands), and A.
   vulcanicus sp. nov. (Spain: Canary Islands). Seven new synonyms are
   proposed: Aulacoderus coarcticollis (Baudi di Selve, 1881) (= Anthicus
   appli Pic, 1900, syn. nov.), A. friwaldszkyi (LaFerte-Senectere, 1849)
   (= Tomoderus funebris Reitter, 1884, Anthicus sulcithorax Desbrochers
   des Loges, 1875, Anthicus melitensis Pic, 1903, Anthicus sulcicollis
   Pic, 1895, syn. nov.), A. mecheriensis (Chobaut, 1896) (= Anthicus
   vaulogeri Pic, 1897, syn. nov.), A. mohammedis (Marseul, 1879) (=
   Anthicus picheyrei Peyerimhoff, 1943, syn. nov.). Lectotypes are
   designated for Anthicus canariensis Wollaston, 1864 and A. friwaldszkyi
   LaFertd-Senectere, 1849. An identification key and check-list are
   provided.
C1 Kejval, Zbynek; Muzeum Chodska, Chodske Namesti 96, Domazlice, CZ-34401,
   Czech Republic, Czech Republic.
EM anthicid@seznam.cz
SC Zoology
SN 1210-6100
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Type material; Description;
   Synonymy; Taxonomy; Status; Key; Documentation; Publications; Land
   zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia; Oceanic islands; Atlantic
   Ocean islands
DE Aulacoderus [Checklists / Distributional checklist / Taxonomic revision]
   [Palaearctic region /  / Key to species & species groups] [ /  / ]. 
   Aulacoderus adensis [Yemen /  / New species]. 
   Aulacoderus crenulifer; Aulacoderus kormosi; Aulacoderus polygoni;
   Aulacoderus setifer; Aulacoderus sibilans; Aulacoderus vulcanicus
   [Canary Islands /  / New species]. 
   Aulacoderus inspinosus [Oman /  / New species] [United Arab Emirates / 
   / ] [Yemen /  / ]. 
   Aulacoderus kamil [Iran /  / New species]. 
   Aulacoderus klapperichi [Israel /  / New species] [Jordan /  / ]. 
   Aulacoderus mithra [Turkey /  / New species] [Iran /  / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Tenebrionoidea,
   Anthicidae
OR Anthicus (Aulacoderus) friwaldszkyi - LaFerte-Senectere 1849
   (Anthicidae): [Lectotype designated, P. 94]. 
   Anthicus canariensis - Wollaston 1864 (Anthicidae): [Lectotype
   designated, P. 64]. 
   Aulacoderus - LaFerte-Senectere 1849 (Anthicidae): [Redescription, P.
   57; Key to species groups, Palaearctic region, P. 59; Key to species,
   Palaearctic region, P. 59]. 
   Aulacoderus adensis (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Yemen, P. 111]. 
   Aulacoderus bucheti - (Pic 1903) (Anthicidae): [Raised from, Aulacoderus
   canariensis bucheti, p. 62]. 
   Aulacoderus canariensis bucheti - (Pic 1903) (Anthicidae): [Raised to,
   Aulacoderus bucheti, p. 62]. 
   Aulacoderus coarcticollis - (Baudi di Selve 1881) (Anthicidae): [Syn
   nov, Anthicus appli Pic 1900, p. 81]. 
   Aulacoderus crenulifer (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Canary Islands, P. 67]. 
   Aulacoderus friwaldszkyi - (LaFerte-Senectere 1849) (Anthicidae): [Syn
   nov, Anthicus (Aulacoderus) melitensis Pic 1903, p. 89; Syn nov,
   Anthicus sulcicollis (Pic 1895), p. 90; Syn nov, Anthicus sulcithorax
   Desbrochers des Loges 1875, p. 90; Syn nov, Tomoderus funebris Reitter
   1884, p. 90]. 
   Aulacoderus inspinosus (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, United Arab Emirates, P.
   102]. 
   Aulacoderus kamil (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Iran, P. 86]. 
   Aulacoderus klapperichi (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Jordan, P. 114]. 
   Aulacoderus kormosi (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Canary Islands, P. 70]. 
   Aulacoderus mecheriensis - (Chobaut 1896) (Anthicidae): [Syn nov,
   Anthicus (Aulacoderus) vaulogeri (Pic 1897), p. 87]. 
   Aulacoderus mithra (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Iran, P. 88]. 
   Aulacoderus mohammedis - (Marseul 1879) (Anthicidae): [Syn nov, Anthicus
   picheyrei Peyerimhoff 1943, p. 99]. 
   Aulacoderus polygoni (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Canary Islands, P. 71]. 
   Aulacoderus postnotatus - (Pic 1910) (Anthicidae): [Raised from,
   Aulacoderus sefrensis var. postnotatus, p. 116]. 
   Aulacoderus sefrensis - (Pic 1894) (Anthicidae): [Removal from synonymy,
   Aulacoderus sefrensis var. postnotatus (Pic 1910), p. 116]. 
   Aulacoderus sefrensis var. postnotatus - (Pic 1910) (Anthicidae):
   [Removal from synonymy, With Aulacoderus sefrensis (Pic 1894), p. 116;
   Raised to, Aulacoderus postnotatus, p. 116]. 
   Aulacoderus setifer (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Canary Islands, P. 75]. 
   Aulacoderus sibilans (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Canary Islands, P. 76]. 
   Aulacoderus vulcanicus (Anthicidae): [Sp nov, Canary Islands, P. 79].

DT Article
TI A new Pygoplatys from Mindanao Island, Philippines (Hemiptera:
   Heteroptera: Tessaratomidae).
AU Magnien, Philippe (philippe@heteroptera.fr) 
SO Klapalekiana
VL 53
IS 1-2
PS 139-146
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Pygoplatys (Odontoteuchus) streitoi sp. nov. (Hemiptera: Heteroptera:
   Tessaratomidae) is described from the Island of Mindanao, Philippines.
   This brings the number of species of the genus Pygoplatys Dallas, 1851
   to thirty-one. Illustration of the three last instars of nymphs is
   given. A revised key to species of the subgenus is given.

   50,45 Rue Buffon, Paris, F-75005, France, France.

PT J
AN ZOOR15309060768
DT Article
TI Three new species of Pristimantis (Amphibia, Anura, Craugastoridae) from
   upper montane forests and high Andean grasslands of the Pui Pui
   Protected Forest in central Peru.
AU Lehr, Edgar (elehr@iwu.edu) 
   Von May, Rudolf
   Moravec, Jiri
   Cusi, Juan Carlos
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 3
PS 301-336
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 8
AB We describe three new species of Pristimantis from the upper montane
   forests and high Andean grasslands of the Pui Pui Protected Forest and
   its close surroundings (Region Junin, central Peru) and compare them
   morphologically and genetically with other taxonomically and
   biogeographically relevant species of Pristimantis. All three new
   species have the skin on dorsum shagreen with scattered tubercles,
   discontinuous dorsolateral folds, tuberculate flanks, and the skin on
   venter areolate. Pristimantis bounides sp. nov. is known from two
   localities outside the Pui Pui Protected Forest in upper montane forests
   between 3350 and 3463 ma.s.l. and is characterized by a snout-vent
   length of 18.2-21.0 mm in males (n = 3), and 21.6-24.4 mm in females (n
   = 4), by having a tympanum, males with vocal slits, and discs of digits
   slightly expanded with circumferential grooves. In life, dorsal and
   lateral ground coloration is pale grayish brown, orange brown, yellowish
   brown or reddish brown with dark grayish-brown marmorations, and a pale
   gray, pale greenish gray or creamish white venter with or without dark
   gray mottling. Pristimantis humboldti sp. nov. is known from one
   locality inside the Pui Pui Protected Forest, in upper montane forest at
   3318 ma.s.l., and is characterized by a snout-vent length of 17.2-20.6
   mm in males (n = 3), and 19.7-25.7 mm in females (n = 6), by having a
   tympanum, males with vocal slits, and discs of digits expanded with
   circumferential grooves. In life, dorsal and lateral ground coloration
   is orange brown with brownisholive blotches, orange brown with
   grayish-brown blotches and flecks, reddish brown with grayish-brown
   blotches or grayish brown with orange brown blotches; throat, chest,
   belly, anterior and ventral surfaces of thighs, tibia, and axilla are
   dark gray and pale gray mottled with white and pale gray spots of
   different sizes and density. Pristimantis puipui sp. nov. is known from
   one locality inside the Pui Pui Protected Forest, in the puna at 3890
   ma.s.l., and is characterized by a snoutvent length of 16.1-17.1 mm in
   males (n = 3), and 20.6-22.4 mm in females (n = 4), by lacking a
   tympanum, lacking males with vocal slits, and tips of digits narrow
   without circumferential grooves. In life, dorsal and lateral ground
   coloration is pale orange brown, reddish brown or grayish brown with or
   without grayish-brown mottling, and the venter is pale cream and pale
   gray mottled. A molecular phylogenetic analysis based on mitochondrial
   and nuclear DNA sequences inferred that the three new species belong to
   the Pristimantis danae species Group distributed in the montane forests
   and high Andean grasslands of central Peru, including P. albertus, P.
   aniptopalmatus, P. ornatus, and P. stictogaster. With the three new
   species, 133 species of Pristimantis are currently known from Peru,
   eight of which inhabit the puna.
C1 Lehr, Edgar; Illinois Wesleyan Univ, Dept Biol, POB 2900, Bloomington,
   IL, 61701, USA, USA.
EM elehr@iwu.edu
SC Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Neotropical region;
   South America
DE Pristimantis bounides; Pristimantis humboldti; Pristimantis puipui [Peru
   /  / New species]. 
TN Amphibians; Chordates; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Amphibia, Lissamphibia, Anura,
   Leptodactylidae

DT Article
TI Taxonomic review of Trans-Andean species of Pimelodus (Siluriformes:
   Pimelodidae), with the descriptions of two new species.
AU Antonio Villa-Navarro, Francisco (favilla@ut.edu.co) 
   Acero P, Arturo
   Cala Cala, Plutarco
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 3
PS 337-360
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 7
AB We review the trans-Andean species of Pimelodus from Colombia, Panama,
   and Venezuela. Based on meristic and morphometric data of preserved
   specimens, four of five species reported from this region are considered
   valid and two new Colombian species are described. Here we review
   Pimelodus coprophagus Schultz, 1944 from Lake Maracaibo Basin of
   Venezuela and Colombia; Pimelodus grosskopfii Steindachner, 1879 from
   Magdalena River Basin; Pimelodus navarroi Schultz, 1944 from Lake
   Maracaibo Basin of Venezuela and Colombia; and Pimelodus punctatus (Meek
   & Hildebrand, 1913) from Atrato, Baudo, and Tuyra River Basins of
   Colombia and Panama. Pimelodus crypticus new species is described from
   the upper Cauca river drainage. Pimelodus yuma new species is described
   from the Cauca, Magdalena, and Sinu river drainages. A key for species
   identification and geographical ranges is provided. We also reidentify
   trans-Andean specimens previously reported as Pimelodus blochii
   Valenciennes, 1840, a widespread cis-Andean species, or species complex,
   that ranges across the coastal rivers of the Guianas and Brazil and the
   Orinoco and Amazon Basins.

PS 384-390
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 4
AB A new species of porcellanid crab, Ancylocheles peterngi n. sp., is
   described on the basis of material collected during crustacean faunal
   surveys along the coasts of the Gujarat State, northwestern India. The
   new species resembles the sole congeneric species, A. gravelei
   (Sankolli, 1963), but is distinguished by the morphology of the
   carapace, third thoracic sternite and antenna.

TI World's northenmost and rarely observed Nudibranchs: three new
   Onchidoridid species (Gastropoda: Doridida) from Russian seas.
AU Martynov, Alexander (martynov@zmmu.msu.ru) 
   Korshunova, Tatiana
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 3
PS 391-404
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 6
AB The world's most northern species of the nudibranch genus Adalaria
   rossica sp. nov. from Franz Josef Land and a new species of Onchidoris
   expectata sp. nov. from the north-west Pacific Matua Island (Kurile
   Islands) are described. Prior to this study the nudibranch fauna from
   Franz Josef Land was represented only by two common North Atlantic
   species. Molecular taxonomic data were not applied for the Franz Josef
   Land nudibranchs previously. Nudibranchs of Matua Island have never been
   investigated. Furthermore, a new North Pacific taxon, Adalaria ultima
   sp. nov., is described here. The taxonomy of the onchidoridid genera
   Adalaria and Onchidoris is discussed.

DT Article
TI A new deep-sea species of the caridean genus Bresilia Calman, 1896
   (Crustacea: Decapoda: Bresiliidae) from Sagami Bay, central Japan.
AU Komai, Tomoyuki (komai@chiba-muse.or.jp) 
   Kohtsuka, Hisanori
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 3
PS 405-414
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB A new species of the rare caridean genus Bresilia Calman, 1896, B.
   cinctus, is described and illustrated on the basis of a single ovigerous
   female specimen collected from Sagami Bay, central Japan, at 218-318 m
   depth. The new species is morphologically most similar to B. rufioculus
   Komai & Yamada, 2011, known only from shallow water cave of Ie Island
   (depths 14-17 m), Okinawa Islands, Ryukyu Islands, but many characters,
   including the proportionally shorter rostrum, the well developed
   suborbital lobe of the carapace, and the presence of a spiniform seta on
   the ventral surface of the pereopod 1 palm, immediately distinguish the
   new species from B. rufioculus. Bresilia cinctus n. sp. is the first
   species of the genus known from the Japanese main islands. The discovery
   of the new species led us to reassess the merit of the informal division
   of Bresilia proposed by Komai & Yamada (2010). An identification key to
   the ten named species of Bresilia is presented.
C1 Komai, Tomoyuki; Nat Hist Museum & Inst, Chuo Ku, 955-2 Aoba Cho, Chiba,
   Chiba, 2608682, Japan, Japan.
EM komai@chiba-muse.or.jp
SC Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Taxonomy; Key; Marine zones;
   Pacific Ocean
DE Bresilia [North Pacific / Japan / New record]. 
   Bresilia cinctus [North Pacific / Japan / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Crustaceans; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Crustacea, Malacostraca, Eumalacostraca, Eucarida,
   Decapoda, Natantia
OR Bresilia - Calman 1896 (Natantia): [Key to species, P. 413; New record].

TI Two new species of clearwing moths (Lepidoptera: Sesiidae) from Taiwan.
AU Liang, Jia-Yuan
   Hsu, Yu-Feng (sesiidae760402@gmail.com) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 3
PS 415-422
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Two new species of Sesiidae (clearwing moth) are described from Taiwan:
   Ceratocorema woodstocki Liang & Hsu sp. nov., and Melittia tao Liang &
   Hsu sp. nov. Diagnostic characters for the two species are presented
   using wing morphology, wing pattern, presence of androconial patches on
   the hindwing, and genitalia. The adults and their genitalia are
   documented, and distribution data are provided. New records of
   relationships between host plants and the immatures are also provided.

TI Two new species of Margarites (Gastropoda: Margaritidae) from
   hydrothermal vent areas, Western Pacific.
AU Zhang, Shuqian
   Zhang, Suping (zsqtaxon@qdio.ac.cn) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 3
PS 441-450
PD Jul 28 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 4
AB During research dives by the submersible ROV Faxian, two margaritid
   species were collected in Okinawa Trough and Manus Back-Arc Basin. In
   present study, we describe and illustrate them as Margarites similis sp.
   nov. and Margarites manusensis sp. nov., respectively. The generic
   allocation is based on shell morphology and radula features.
   Phylogenetic reconstruction using the cytochrome c oxidase subunit I
   (COI) gene also supports their placements within Margarites.

DT Article
TI Two new species of the Brachycephalus pernix group (Anura:
   Brachycephalidae) from the state of Parana, southern Brazil.
AU Ribeiro, Luiz F. (luxfernando@gmail.com) 
   Blackburn, David C.
   Stanley, Edward L.
   Pie, Marcio R.
   Bornschein, Marcos R.
SO PeerJ
VL 5
PS e3603
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 6
AB We describe two new species of miniaturized toadlet in the B. pernix
   group of Brachycephalus (Anura: Brachycephalidae) from the Atlantic
   Forest of the state of Parana, southern Brazil. The first new species is
   distinguished from all congeners by the pale red coloration from the
   head to the pelvic region, with sides of the body and thighs dorsally
   yellowish green. It is known only from the type locality in a cloud
   forest at altitudes ranging between 1,144-1,228 m a.s.l. The second
   species, although more closely related to B. izecksohni, is
   morphologically similar to B. brunneus in its overall brown coloration,
   but distinct from that species in the color of the iris (black with
   conspicuous golden spots, instead of entirely black). It was found on
   three mountains, at altitudes between 1,095-1,320 m a.s.l., and in
   vegetation types including cloud forest, montane forest, and secondary
   forest. The two new species exhibit neither vertebral fusions nor
   osteoderms, but one has both a distinct neopalatine and well-developed
   odontoids on the maxillae. We discuss the conservation status of both
   species.
C1 Ribeiro, Luiz F.; Pontificia Univ Catolica Parana, Escola Ciencias Vida,
   Curitiba, Parana, Brazil, Brazil.
EM luxfernando@gmail.com
RI Blackburn, David C./L-3812-2019; Bornschein, Marcos R./A-1303-2013
OI Blackburn, David C./0000-0002-1810-9886; Bornschein, Marcos
   R./0000-0002-6486-7055; Stanley, Edward/0000-0001-5257-037X
SC Zoology
SN 2167-8359
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Neotropical region;
   South America
DE Brachycephalus coloratus; Brachycephalus curupira [Brazil /  / New
   species]. 
TN Amphibians; Chordates; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Amphibia, Lissamphibia, Anura,
   Brachycephalidae
OR Brachycephalus coloratus (Brachycephalidae): [Sp nov, Brazil, P. 4]. 
   Brachycephalus curupira (Brachycephalidae): [Sp nov, Brazil, P. 11]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15311070679
OA DOAJ Gold, Green Published
DA 2020-09-17

PT J
AN ZOOR15311070607
PM 28751667
DT Article
TI High diversity of the Ganzhou Oviraptorid Fauna increased by a new
   'cassowary-like' crested species.
AU Lu, Junchang (Lujc2008@126.com) 
   Li, Guoqing
   Kundrat, Martin
   Lee, Yuong-Nam
   Sun, Zhenyuan
   Kobayashi, Yoshitsugu
   Shen, Caizhi
   Teng, Fangfang
   Liu, Hanfeng
SO Scientific Reports
VL 7
PS 6393
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 12
AB A new oviraptorid dinosaur from the Late Cretaceous of Ganzhou, bringing
   oviraptrotid diversity of this region to seven taxa, is described. It is
   characterized by a distinct cassowary-like crest on the skull, no
   pleurocoels on the centra from the second through fourth cervical
   vertebrae, a neck twice as long as the dorsal vertebral column and
   slightly longer than the forelimb (including the manus). Phylogenetic
   analysis recovers the new oviraptorid taxon, Corythoraptor jacobsi, as
   closely related to Huanansaurus from Ganzhou. Osteochronology suggests
   that the type specimen of Corythoraptor had not reached stationary
   growth stage but died while decreasing growth rates. The histology
   implies that it would correspond to an immature individual approximately
   eight years old. We hypothesize, based on the inner structure compared
   to that in modern cassowaries, that the prominent casque of
   Corythoraptor was a multifunction-structure utilized in display,
   communication and probably expression of the fitness during mating
   seasons.
C1 Lu, Junchang; Chinese Acad Geol Sci, Inst Geol, Beijing, 100037, China,
   China.
EM Lujc2008@126.com
RI Kundrat, Martin/F-4959-2017
OI Kundrat, Martin/0000-0001-9361-2273
SC Zoology
SN 2045-2322
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Palaearctic region;
   Eurasia; Asia; China; Geological time periods; Mesozoic
DE Corythoraptor [Cretaceous /  / New genus]. 
   Corythoraptor jacobsi [Jiangxi /  / new species] [Cretaceous /  / ]. 
TN Chordates; Reptiles; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Reptilia, Archosauria, Saurischia,
   Theropoda
OR Corythoraptor (Theropoda): [Gen nov, Of family Oviraptoridae, Type
   species Corythoraptor jacobsi, p. 2, Cretaceous; Fossil]. 
   Corythoraptor jacobsi (Theropoda): [Sp nov, Jiangxi, Cretaceous, P. 2;
   Fossil]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15311070607
OA DOAJ Gold, Green Published
DA 2020-09-17
ER

PT J
AN ZOOR15310066071
PM 28751634
DT Article
TI Global biogeography, cryptic species and systematic issues in the shrimp
   genus Hippolyte Leach, 1814 (Decapoda: Caridea: Hippolytidae) by
   multimarker analyses.
AU Terossi, Mariana (mterossirm@gmail.com) 
   De Grave, Sammy
   Mantelatto, Fernando L.
SO Scientific Reports
VL 7
PS 6697
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 1
U2 11
AB Hippolyte is a genus of small bodied marine shrimps, with a global
   distribution. Here, we studied the phylogenetic and biogeographic
   relationships amongst the species of this genus with two mitochondrial
   and two nuclear markers, using Bayesian Inference, Maximum Likelihood,
   genetic divergence, molecular clock and S-DIVA. In addition, the
   Indo-West Pacific genus Alcyonohippolyte was included. Based on
   sequences from 57 specimens of 27 species, we recovered a robust
   biogeographic scenario that shows the Indo-West Pacific as the probable
   ancestral area of the genus Hippolyte, which emerged in the Paleocene,
   followed by dispersal in three general directions: (1) South Pacific,
   (2) eastern Atlantic and Mediterranean Sea and (3) Americas, the latter
   with a primary colonization in the eastern Pacific followed by a
   radiation into the western Atlantic. Our analysis reveals that the
   species of the H. ventricosa group do not constitute a monophyletic
   group and Alcyonohippolyte does not constitute a reciprocally
   monophyletic group to Hippolyte, with both genera herein synonimised.
   The relationships and systematic status of several transisthmian and
   Atlantic species are clarified.
C1 Terossi, Mariana; USP, LBSC, Ave Bandeirantes 3900, Sao Paulo,
   BR-14040901 BC, Brazil, Brazil.
EM mterossirm@gmail.com
RI Mantelatto, Fernando/N-9536-2019; Mantelatto, Fernando L/H-2695-2012;
   Terossi, Mariana/J-7946-2012
OI Mantelatto, Fernando/0000-0002-8497-187X; Mantelatto, Fernando
   L/0000-0002-8497-187X; Terossi, Mariana/0000-0002-6860-7883
SC Genetics &Heredity; Zoology; Evolutionary Biology
SN 2045-2322
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; Combination; Synonymy; Taxonomy; Taxonomic
   position; Genetics; Evolution; Zoogeography
DE Alcyonohippolyte; Hippolyte [Molecular genetics / Mt & nuclear markers /
   systematics] [Phylogeny /  / ] [Variation / Genetic diversity / ]
   [Zoogeography / Global biogeography / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Crustaceans; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Crustacea, Malacostraca, Eumalacostraca, Eucarida,
   Decapoda, Natantia
OR Alcyonohippolyte - Marin, Okuno & Chan 2011 (Natantia). 
   Alcyonohippolyte commensalis - (Kemp 1925) (Natantia): [Referred to,
   Hippolyte, p. 5]. 
   Alcyonohippolyte dossena - Marin, Chan & Okuno 2011 (Natantia):
   [Referred to, Hippolyte, p. 5].

   8].

PT J
AN ZOOR15310066072
PM 28751684
DT Article
TI Lower Cretaceous fossils from China shed light on the ancestral body
   plan of crown softshell turtles (Trionychidae, Cryptodira).
AU Brinkman, Donald (don.brinkman@gov.ab.ca) 
   Rabi, Marton
   Zhao, Lijun
SO Scientific Reports
VL 7
PS 6719
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 6
AB Pan-trionychids or softshell turtles are a highly specialized and
   widespread extant group of aquatic taxa with an evolutionary history
   that goes back to the Early Cretaceous. The earliest pan-trionychids had
   already fully developed the "classic" softshell turtle morphology and it
   has been impossible to resolve whether they are stem members of the
   family or are within the crown. This has hindered our understanding of
   the evolution of the two basic body plans of crown-trionychids. Thus it
   remains unclear whether the more heavily ossified shell of the
   cyclanorbines or the highly reduced trionychine morphotype is the
   ancestral condition for softshell turtles. A new pan-trionychid from the
   Early Cretaceous of Zhejiang, China, Perochelys hengshanensis sp. nov.,
   allows a revision of softshell-turtle phylogeny. Equal character
   weighting resulted in a topology that is fundamentally inconsistent with
   molecular divergence date estimates of deeply nested extant species. In
   contrast, implied weighting retrieved Lower Cretaceous Perochelys spp.
   and Petrochelys kyrgyzensis as stem trionychids, which is fully
   consistent with their basal stratigraphic occurrence and an
   Aptian-Santonian molecular age estimate for crown-trionychids. These
   results indicate that the primitive morphology for softshell turtles is
   a poorly ossified shell like that of crown-trionychines and that shell
   re-ossification in cyclanorbines (including re-acquisition of peripheral
   elements) is secondary.
C1 Brinkman, Donald; Royal Tyrrell Museum Palaeontol, Box 7500, Drumheller,
   AB, T0J 0Y0, Canada, Canada.
EM don.brinkman@gov.ab.ca
SC Zoology; Anatomy &Morphology; Evolutionary Biology
SN 2045-2322
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; General morphology; Skeletal and
   supporting structures; Skeleton; Evolution; Land zones; Palaearctic
   region; Eurasia; Asia; China; Geological time periods; Mesozoic
DE Perochelys hengshanensis [Zhejiang /  / new species] [Cretaceous /  / ].
   
   Trionychidae [Body form / Ancestral body plan / significance of new
   fossil species from China] [Dermal skeleton / Shell / ] [Phylogeny /  /
   ]. 
TN Chordates; Reptiles; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Reptilia, Anapsida, Testudines,
   Cryptodira
OR Perochelys hengshanensis (Cryptodira): [Sp nov, Zhejiang, Cretaceous, P.
   2; Fossil]. 
   Trionychidae (Cryptodira). 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15310066072
OA DOAJ Gold, Green Published
DA 2020-09-17
ER

PT J
AN ZOOR15310066007
DT Article
TI The neotropical stingless bee genus Nannotrigona Cockerell (Hymenoptera:
   Apidae: Meliponini): An illustrated key, notes on the types, and
   designation of lectotypes.
AU Rasmussen, Claus (alrunen@yahoo.com) 
   Gonzalez, Victor H.
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 2
PS 191-220
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 2
AB We provide comparative comments on the morphology and provenance of the
   primary types of the species in the stingless bee genus Nannotrigona
   Cockerell. We offer an illustrated key to workers of all presently known
   species and designate lectotypes for the following species to stabilize
   their names: N. dutrae (Friese), N. mellaria (Smith), N. punctata
   (Smith), and N. schultezi (Friese). The type of Melipona minuta
   Lepeletier de Saint Fargeau could not be located and it remains an
   incertae sedis, but a possible member of Nannotrigona. A distinctive new
   species from western Ecuador, Nannotrigona camargoi n. sp. (type
   locality Ecuador, Pichincha) is also described and figured.
C1 Rasmussen, Claus; Aarhus Univ, Dept Biosci, Ole Worms Alle 1, Aarhus,
   DK-8000, Denmark, Denmark.
EM alrunen@yahoo.com
SC Anatomy &Morphology; Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Type material; Description;
   Taxonomy; Key; Biometrics; Land zones; Neotropical region; South America
DE Nannotrigona [Biometrics / Morphometrics / Systematics] [Neotropical
   region /  / distribution]. 
   Nannotrigona camargoi [Ecuador /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Hymenopterans; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Hymenoptera, Apocrita, Aculeata, Apoidea,
   Apidae
OR Nannotrigona - Cockerell 1922 (Apidae): [Key to species, Workers, p.
   195]. 
   Nannotrigona camargoi (Apidae): [Sp nov, Ecuador, P. 209]. 
   Nannotrigona dutrae - (Friese 1901) (Apidae): [Redescription, P. 196]. 
   Nannotrigona melanocera - (Schwarz 1938) (Apidae): [Redescription, P.
   203]. 
   Nannotrigona mellaria - (Smith 1862) (Apidae): [Redescription, P. 204]. 
   Nannotrigona perilampoides - (Cresson 1878) (Apidae): [Redescription, P.
   213]. 
   Nannotrigona punctata - (Smith 1854) (Apidae): [Redescription, P. 214]. 
   Nannotrigona schultzei - (Friese 1901) (Apidae): [Redescription, P.
   200]. 
   Nannotrigona testaceicornis - (Lepeletier de Saint Fargeau 1836)
   (Apidae): [Redescription, P. 215]. 
   Nannotrigona tristella - (Cockerell 1922) (Apidae): [Redescription, P.
   208]. 
   Trigona dutra - Friese 1901 (Apidae): [Lectotype designated, P. 196]. 
   Trigona mellarius - Smith 1862 (Apidae): [Lectotype designated, P. 203].
   
   Trigona perilampoides - Cresson 1878 (Apidae): [Lectotype designated, P.
   213]. 
   Trigona punctata - Smith 1854 (Apidae): [Lectotype designated, P. 214]. 
   Trigona schultzei - Friese 1901 (Apidae): [Lectotype designated, P.
   200].

DT Article
TI A new species of Megacormus (Scorpiones, Euscorpiidae) from an oak-pine
   forest in Guanajuato, Mexico with an identification key to the species
   in the genus.
AU Gonzalez-Santillan, Edmundo (maaykuyak@gmail.com) 
   Manuel Gonzalez-Ruiz, Juan
   Escobedo-Morales, Luis A.
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 2
PS 221-237
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The fifth species of the genus, Megacormus xichu sp. nov., is described
   and compared to the other species. An identification key to these
   species as well as a distributional map with localities taken from the
   literature are provided.

PT J
AN ZOOR15310065879
DT Article
TI The genus Arocatus in Taiwan (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Lygaeidae).
AU Tsai, Jing-Fu (jingfu.tsai@gmail.com) 
   Redei, David
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 2
PS 238-252
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Species of the genus Arocatus Spinola, 1837 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera:
   Lygaeidae: Lygaeinae) occurring in Taiwan are reviewed, illustrated and
   keyed. Arocatus elegantulus sp. nov. is described; earlier records of
   Caenocoris dimidiatus Breddin, 1907 from Taiwan and the Ryukyu
   Archipelago of Japan pertain to this new species. Arocatus
   pseudosericans Gao, Kondorosy & Bu, 2013 and A. nanus (Breddin, 1900)
   are recorded for the first time from Taiwan; earlier records of A.
   sericans (Stal, 1859) pertain to A. pseudosericans. The distribution of
   A. sericans and A. pseudosericans in Japan and Korea and the
   intraspecific variability of A. pseudosericans are discussed. The
   identification problems of the genera Arocatus, Caenocoris Fieber, 1860
   and Thunbergia Horvath, 1914 are highlighted, the external male
   genitalia of T. cf. marginata (Thunberg, 1822) are described and
   illustrated, and diagnostic characters potentially suitable for
   distinguishing Thunbergia from Arocatus are provided.
C1 Tsai, Jing-Fu; Natl Museum Nat Sci, Dept Biol, 1 Kuan Chien Rd,
   Taichung, Taiwan, Taiwan.
EM jingfu.tsai@gmail.com
SC Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Diagnosis; Taxonomy; Key; Land
   zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia
DE Arocatus [Taiwan /  / Key to species] [ /  / Distribution; taxonomic
   review]. 
   Arocatus elegantulus [Japan /  / New species] [Taiwan /  / ]. 
   Arocatus nanus [Taiwan /  / New record]. 
   Arocatus pseudosericans [South Korea /  / New record] [Taiwan /  / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Insects; Invertebrates; True Bugs
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Hemiptera, Heteroptera, Pentatomomorpha,
   Lygaeoidea, Lygaeidae
OR Lygaeidae (Lygaeoidea): [Diagnostic characters of subordinate taxa,
   Genera, p. 250]. 
   Arocatus - Spinola 1837 (Lygaeidae): [Key to species, Taiwan, P. 250]. 
   Arocatus elegantulus (Lygaeidae): [Sp nov, Taiwan, P. 239]. 
   Arocatus nanus (Lygaeidae): [New record]. 
   Arocatus pseudosericans (Lygaeidae): [New record]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15310065879

DT Article
TI New species of Neotropical Acanthocinini (Coleoptera, Cerambycidae,
   Lamiinae).
AU Monne, Marcela L.
   Monne, Miguel A.
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 2
PS 253-262
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Six new species of Neotropical Acanthocinini are described and
   illustrated: Sympagus cooperi sp. nov. from Ecuador, Cobelura inornata
   sp. nov. from Costa Rica, Lepturges (L.) attaleae sp. nov. from Brazil
   and Paranisopodus amoenus sp. nov., Cobelura raphaeli sp. nov. and
   Cleodoxus tetralophus sp. nov. from Bolivia. Keys for the genera
   Sympagus Bates, 1881, Cobelura Erichson, 1847, Paranisopodus Monne &
   Martins, 1976 and Lepturges Bates, 1863 with unicolorous integument and
   uniform pubescence are provided.
C1 Monne, Marcela L.; Univ Fed Rio de Janeiro, Quinta Boa Vista Sao
   Cristovao, Rio De Janeiro, BR-20940040 BC, Brazil, Brazil.

   Integument unicolor and sparse uniform yellowish, brownish or greyish
   fulvous pubescence, p. 261].

TI A new Trogoderma species from Central Madagascar (Coleoptera:
   Dermestidae: Megatominae).
AU Hava, Jiri

SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 2
PS 279-284
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB A new species, Trogoderma sahondrae sp. nov., from Central Madagascar is
   described and illustrated and a key to all known Madagascan species is
   provided. The new species differs from other related species by the
   combination of colour of the elytral fasciae, structure of antennae, and
   male genitalia.

TI Further study on Rhopobota Lederer (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae:
   Olethreutinae) from China.
AU Zhang, Aihuan (zhangaihuan@126.com) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 2
PS 297-300
PD Jul 27 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Two new species of Rhopobota Lederer are described from China: R.
   projecta Zhang, sp. nov., and R. quadrata Zhang, sp. nov. The female of
   R. floccosa Zhang, Li & Wang is reported for the first time. Photographs
   of the adults and illustrations of the genitalia are provided. All of
   the specimens are deposited in the Insect Collection, Nankai University,
   Tianjin, China.

PT J
AN ZOOR15312079458
PM 28746370
DT Article
TI Neogene Proto-Caribbean porcupinefishes (Diodontidae).
AU Aguilera, Orange
   Andrade Silva, Guilherme Oliveira (guilhermeoas@id.uff.br) 
   Lopes, Ricardo Tadeu
   Machado, Alessandra Silveira
   dos Santos, Thais Maria
   Marques, Gabriela
   Bertucci, Thayse
   Aguiar, Thayanne
   Carrillo-Briceno, Jorge
   Rodriguez, Felix
   Jaramillo, Carlos
SO PLoS ONE
VL 12
IS 7
PS e0181670
PD Jul 26 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 4
AB Fossil Diodontidae in Tropical America consist mostly of isolated and
   fused beak-like jawbones, and tooth plate batteries. These durophagous
   fishes are powerful shell-crushing predators on shallow water
   invertebrate faunas from Neogene tropical carbonate bottom, rocky reefs
   and surrounding flats. We use an ontogenetic series of high-resolution
   micro CT of fossil and extant species to recognize external and internal
   morphologic characters of jaws and tooth plate batteries. We compare
   similar sizes of jaws and/or tooth-plates from both extant and extinct
   species. Here, we describe three new fossil species including [dagger]
   Chilomycterus exspectatus n. sp. and [dagger] Chilomycterus tyleri n.
   sp. from the late Miocene Gatun Formation in Panama, and [dagger] Diodon
   serratus n. sp. from the middle Miocene Socorro Formation in Venezuela.
   Fossil Diodontidae review included specimens from the Neogene Basins of
   the Proto-Caribbean (Brazil: Pirabas Formation; Colombia: Jimol
   Formation, Panama: Gatun and Tuira formations; Venezuela: Socorro and
   Cantaure formations). Diodon is present in both the Atlantic and Pacific
   oceans, whereas the distribution of Chilomycterus is highly asymmetrical
   with only one species in the Pacific. It seems that Diodon was as
   abundant in the Caribbean/Western Atlantic during the Miocene as it is
   there today. We analyze the paleogeographic distribution of the
   porcupinefishes group in Tropical America, after the complete exhumation
   of the Panamanian isthmus during the Pliocene.
C1 Andrade Silva, Guilherme Oliveira; Univ Fed Fluminense, Inst Biol,
   Niteroi, RJ, Brazil, Brazil.
EM guilhermeoas@id.uff.br
RI Lopes, Ricardo T/O-8840-2014
OI Lopes, Ricardo T/0000-0001-7250-824X; Oliveira Andrade da Silva,
   Guilherme/0000-0003-2625-1089; Aguilera, Orangel/0000-0003-4418-8351
SC Zoology; Paleontology; Anatomy &Morphology
SN 1932-6203
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Skeletal and supporting structures;
   Skeleton; Dentition; Teeth; Skull; Zoogeography; Land zones; Neotropical
   region; Central America; South America; Geological time periods;
   Caenozoic; Tertiary; Neogene
DE Chilomycterus exspectatus; Chilomycterus tyleri [Panama /  / new
   species] [Miocene /  / ]. 
   Diodon serratus [Venezuela /  / new species] [Miocene /  / ]. 
   Diodontidae [Toothplates /  / systematics; extant & extinct species]
   [Jaws /  / ] [Zoogeography / Biogeography / ] [South America /  /
   distribution] [Neogene /  / ]. 
TN Chordates; Fish; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Pisces, Osteichthyes, Actinopterygii,
   Tetraodontiformes, Diodontidae
OR Diodontidae (Tetraodontiformes): [Fossil]. 
   Chilomycterus exspectatus - Aguilera, Carrillo-Briceno & Rodriguez 2017
   (Diodontidae): [Sp nov, Panama, Miocene, P. 14; Fossil]. 
   Chilomycterus tyleri - Aguilera, Carrillo-Briceno & Rodrigue 2017
   (Diodontidae): [Sp nov, Panama, Miocene, P. 13; Fossil]. 
   Diodon serratus - Aguilera, Carrillo-Briceno & Rodriguez 2017
   (Diodontidae): [Sp nov, Venezuela, Miocene, P. 15; Fossil]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15312079458
OA DOAJ Gold, Green Accepted, Green Published
DA 2020-09-17

PM 28746406
DT Article
TI Multiple approaches to understanding the taxonomic status of an
   enigmatic new scorpion species of the genus Tityus (Buthidae) from the
   biogeographic island of Paraje Tres Cerros (Argentina).
AU Ojanguren-Affilastro, Andres A. (ojanguren@macn.gov.ar) 
   Adilardi, Renzo S.
   Cajade, Rodrigo
   Ramirez, Martin J.
   Sara Ceccarelli, F.
   Mola, Liliana M.
SO PLoS ONE
VL 12
IS 7
PS e0181337
PD Jul 26 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 5
AB Tityus curupi n. sp., belonging to the bolivianus complex, is described
   from the biogeogra-phically distinct area of Paraje Tres Cerros in
   north-eastern Argentina. We also present a molecular species
   delimitation analysis between Tityus curupi n. sp. and its sister
   species Tityus uruguayensis Borelli 1901 to confirm species integrity.
   Furthermore, a cytogenetic analysis is presented for these two species
   which contain different multivalent associations in meiosis, as a
   consequence of chromosome rearrangements, and the highest chromosome
   numbers in the genus.
C1 Ojanguren-Affilastro, Andres A.; Museo Argentino Ciencias Nat Bernardino
   Rivadavia, Buenos Aires, DF, Argentina, Argentina.

PT J
AN ZOOR15310066004
PM 28783028
DT Article
TI Castosyringophilus meropis sp. n. (Acariformes: Syringophilidae) - a new
   quill mite species parasitising the world population of Merops apiaster
   Linnaeus (Coraciiformes: Meropidae).
AU Skoracki, Maciej (skoracki@amu.edu.pl) 
   Hromada, Martin
   Sikora, Bozena
SO Folia Parasitologica (Ceske Budejovice)
VL 64
PS 024
PD Jul 26 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 5
AB A new species, Castosyringophilus meropis sp. n., found in quills of
   feathers of the European bee-eater Merops apiaster Linnaeus
   (Coraciiformes: Meropidae) is described. This new species is close to C.
   claravis Skoracki et Glowska, 2008 and differs, in females, by the
   presence apunctate coxal fields (vs sparsely punctate in C. claravis)
   and by the lengths of setae d1 145-180 [mu]m, f2 170-185 [mu]m and ag3
   190-215 [mu]m (vs d1 200-220 [mu]m, f2 230-250 [mu]m and ag3 150-170
   [mu]m). We present a vast mite material collected from bee-eaters
   originated from different localities in Europe, Asia and Africa, both
   breeding and wintering grounds of this bird. It indicates that the whole
   world population of the European bee-eater is parasitised by this quill
   mite species.
C1 Skoracki, Maciej; Adam Mickiewicz Univ, Fac Biol, Umultowska 89, Poznan,
   PL-61614, Poland, Poland.
EM skoracki@amu.edu.pl
RI Hromada, Martin/I-7409-2019
OI Hromada, Martin/0000-0002-5626-1205; Sikora, Bozena/0000-0002-3395-9993
SC Parasitology; Zoology
SN 0015-5683
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Parasites diseases and disorders;
   Parasites; Hosts; Land zones; Afrotropical region; Oriental region;
   Palaearctic region; Africa; Eurasia; Asia; Europe; France; Italy
DE Castosyringophilus meropis [Avian hosts / Merops apiaster / New parasite
   species; Tanzania & Turkey] [ /  / ] [Kenya /  / New species from avian
   host] [Morocco /  / ] [Tanzania /  / ] [Russia /  / ] [Turkey /  / ]

   /  / ] [Gibraltar /  / ] [Greece /  / ] [Sardinia /  / ] [Macedonia /  /
   ] [Romania /  / ] [Spain /  / ]. 
   Merops apiaster [Arachnid parasites / Castosyringophilus meropis / New
   parasite species; Tanzania & Turkey] [ /  / ] [Kenya /  / New arachnid
   parasite species] [Morocco /  / ] [Tanzania /  / ] [Russia /  / ]
   [Turkey /  / ] [Azerbaijan /  / ] [Pakistan /  / ] [Bosnia-Herzegovina /

   [Macedonia /  / ] [Romania /  / ] [Spain /  / ].

   Coraciiformes, Meropidae

PT J
AN ZOOR15310065814
DT Article
TI Barsura Volynkin, Dubatolov & Kishida, gen. nov., with descriptions of
   three new species (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae).
AU Volynkin, Anton V.
   Dubatolov, Vladimir V. (volynkin_a@mail.ru) 
   Kishida, Yasunori
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 1
PS 54-74
PD Jul 26 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 1
U2 1
AB The new genus Barsura Volynkin, Dubatolov & Kishida, gen. nov. is
   described for Barsine nubifascia Walker, 1864. Three new species,
   B.clandestina Volynkin, Dubatolov & Kishida, sp. nov., B. obscura
   Volynkin, Dubatolov & Kishida, sp. nov. and B. contrastata Volynkin,
   Dubatolov & Kishida, sp. nov. are described from China. B.
   simplicifascia (Elwes, 1890), stat. nov. is upgraded to the species
   level. Three species previously treated as Asura, B. lineata (Fang,
   2000), comb. nov., B. melanoleuca (Hampson, 1894), comb. nov. and B.
   umbrifera (Hampson, 1900), comb. nov. are transferred to Barsura, and
   one species, Barsine umbrosa (Hampson, 1896) comb. nov. is transferred
   to Barsine. The name lineata Fang, 1993 is restored as valid. Adults,
   male and female genitalia of all Barsura species and representatives of
   the related genera Barsine and Asura are illustrated.
C1 Dubatolov, Vladimir V.; SB RAS, Inst Syst & Ecol Anim, Frunze Str 11,
   Novosibirsk, RF-630091, Russia, Russia.
EM volynkin_a@mail.ru
RI Volynkin, Anton V/K-4563-2013
OI Volynkin, Anton V/0000-0001-9447-4925

SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Type species; Combination;
   Synonymy; Taxonomy; Taxonomic position; Documentation; Publications;
   Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia; China
DE Barsura [Checklists / Taxonomic checklist / ]. 
   Barsura clandestina [Sichuan /  / New species] [Yunnan /  / ].

   Barsura obscura [Sichuan /  / New species] [Xizang /  / ] [Yunnan /  /

PT J
AN ZOOR15310066738
DT Article
TI New Species of Blindsnakes (Squamata: Gerrhopilidae) from the offshore
   islands of Papua New Guinea.
AU Kraus, Fred (fkraus@umich.edu) 
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 1
PS 75-94
PD Jul 26 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB I describe four new species of blindsnake of the genus Gerrhopilus from
   islands off the southeastern tip of New Guinea and from New Ireland to
   the northeast. All have ventral keels on the rostral scale, and most
   have previously been assigned in their respective museum collections to
   the species G. depressiceps. Examination of available specimens shows G.
   depressiceps to be a composite of species, and I emend the diagnosis of
   that species based on the holotype and one additional specimen from
   northeastern New Guinea. The species described as new here differ from
   G. depressiceps and from each other in a series of features, including
   shape of the snout, shape of the rostral scale, numbers of mid-dorsal
   scale rows, reduction patterns in longitudinal scale rows, body mass,
   degree of eye development, and color pattern. The new species all
   inhabit islands remote from the known range of G. depressiceps on New
   Guinea and have likely been separated from that species for millions of
   years.
C1 Kraus, Fred; Department of Biology, University of Michigan, 830 N.
   University, Ann Arbor, MI 48109, USA, USA.
EM fkraus@umich.edu
SC Zoology
SN 1175-5326; 1175-5334

   Key; Land zones; Australasian region; Australasia
DE Gerrhopilus addisoni; Gerrhopilus eurydice; Gerrhopilus lestes;
   Gerrhopilus persephone [Papua New Guinea /  / New species]. 
TN Chordates; Reptiles; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Reptilia, Lepidosauria, Squamata,
   Serpentes, Typhlopidae
OR Gerrhopilus - Fiztinger 1843 (Typhlopidae): [Diagnostic characters of
   subordinate taxa, P. 83]. 
   Gerrhopilus addisoni (Typhlopidae): [Sp nov, Papua New Guinea, P. 80].

   P. 90].

   Gerrhopilus lestes (Typhlopidae): [Sp nov, Papua New Guinea, P. 89]. 
   Gerrhopilus persephone (Typhlopidae): [Sp nov, Papua New Guinea, P. 84].

   Zhuang Autonomous Region, southcentral China based on male adult, larva
   and drumming signals, and validation of the Japanese species of the
   genus.

   Muranyi, David
   Orci, Kirill Mark
   Uchida, Shigekazu
   Wang, Rongfeng

PD Jul 26 2017

LA English
U1 0
U2 3
AB Sinacroneuria obscura Li & Muranyi, sp. n. is proposed from Guangxi
   Zhuang Autonomous Region, southcentral China. The new species is
   described on the basis of male adult, male and female larvae, and
   drumming signal. This new taxon is compared with related congeners.
   Sinacroneuria acuticornis Uchida, sp. n. is proposed to validate the
   manuscript name Nishineuria cornuta Uchida, 1990. The male and larva of
   Acroneuriini incertae sedis sensu Shimizu et al. (2005) confirmed to
   refer to this species.

TI Erro gen. n. a new genus of featherwing beetles (Coleoptera: Ptiliidae)
   from Angola and Madagascar.
AU Darby, Michael
SO Zootaxa
VL 4299
IS 1
PS 137-140
PD Jul 26 2017
PY 2017
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Erro gen. n. a new genus of Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) with the new species
   impiger sp. n. and angolensis sp. n. is described and figured based on
   material collected in Angola and Madagascar. Pending further work on the
   phylogeny of the Ptiliidae the new genus is placed in the subfamily
   Ptiliinae where it appears to occupy a place close to the tribe
   Discheramocephalini.
